position.marginalia_text: Cadwallo Rex Britonu[m] a[nn]o - 620 fert 630 Cadvaladrus Rex Britonum a[nno] - 667 - 677 Ceduualla Rex Westsaxonu[m] - 673 Ine Rex Westsaxonu[m] - 675 Idem Radulfus Cadualladrus filius Caduallonis, cum 12 annis regnasset incidit in infirmitatem. Britannia, fame nimia sup[p]lementa, consumpta est. Cadualladrus cu[m] navigio miserabili petijt Alanum Rege[m] Armoricoro[rum] [etc]. A papa Sergio confirmatus est [etc.]; Mortuus est a[nn]o 689. Ivor filius Cadualladri Saxones infestarat 80 annis [etc.].

marginalia.translation: Cadwallon, king of the Britons from 620 to 630. Cadwaladr, king of the Britons from 667-679. Caedwalla, king of West-Saxony from 673. Ine, king of West-Saxony from 675. Radulfus the same. Cadwaladr son of Cadwallo, after having reigned for twelve years, fell into sickness. Britain, gripped by great famine, was consumed. Cadwaladr went with a miserable ship to Alanus king of the Armoricans [=Bretons]. He was confirmed by pope Sergius I et cetera. He died in the year 689. Ivor, son of Cadwaladr, attacked the Saxons for 80 years.

position.marginalia_text: ] Hinc co[m]poni magna co[n]troversia p[rou]t de ipsis duob[us] sepenumere confuse no[m]i[n]atis [etc.]: a diversitate te[m]poru[m] q[u]o regnare ceperunt

marginalia.translation: From this a great confusion has arisen, because the names of these two are confused countless times, and because of the differece of time when they began to reign

position.marginalia_text: J[ohn] D[ee]. Controversia videri p[rou]t de filio Cadovalladri, eo quod quida[m] Idwallum ponu[n]t, alij vero Ivor. At Conveniunt quoniam illi [deleted] nomen erat, Idwall Iwrch. Unde quida[m] [pro] Iwrch ponunt Ivor. errore facile: et alij nome[n] primaru[m] Idwall retinent: [etc.].

marginalia.translation: John Dee. Confusion has arisen because of Cadwalladr's son, in that some call him Idwallo and others Ivor. But this was because his name was Idwall Iwyrch, it contains both. Wherefore some write Ivor instead of Iwyrch, an easy error, and others preserve his first name Idwall: et cetera.
